subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Oracle at Delphi: Where Gods Spoke
description: A 60-second lesson on The Oracle at Delphi: Where Gods Spoke.

hook.text: Kings and generals traveled for weeks to hear a woman mutter riddles. Delphi was the ancient hotline to the gods.

buildup.text: The Pythia, a priestess of Apollo, sat over a crack in the earth and inhaled fumes. Her trance produced prophecies.

discovery.text: Her prophecies were deliberately vague. 'A great empire will fall,' she told Croesus. She didn't say which one.

twist.text: Modern geology found ethylene gas seeping from the rocks at Delphi. The oracle's visions may have been chemical.

climax.text: Delphi was the ancient world's most sacred site for a thousand years. Faith, politics, and geology intertwined.

punchline.text: Gas fumes, vague riddles, and total power. Delphi ran on ambiguity.

quiz.question: What might have caused the Oracle's visions?
options: Ethylene gas seeping from rocks beneath the temple
